intro: Nautilocalyx glandulifer, commonly known as the glandular-leaf nautilocalyx, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine, glandular hairs. The flowers are typically white or pale yellow and are arranged in clusters at the base of the plant. The plant produces small, spherical fruits that contain a single seed. It is native to tropical regions of Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments.
